text.__SUMMARY__: Conasprella mindana is a species of sea snail, a marine gastropod mollusk in the family Conidae, the cone snails and their allies.Like all species within the genus Conasprella, these snails are predatory and venomous. They are capable of "stinging" humans, therefore live ones should be handled carefully or not at all.
text.Subspecies:
Conasprella  mindanus  bermudensis Clench, W.J., 1962
Conasprella mindana mindana (Hwass in Bruguière, 1792)
text.Distribution: This marine species occurs in the Caribbean Sea off Costa Rica; in the Atlantic Ocean off Eastern Brazil and Bermuda
text.Description: The maximum recorded shell length is 50 mm.
text.Habitat: Minimum recorded depth is 0 m. Maximum recorded depth is 210 m.
text.References: Puillandre N., Duda T.F., Meyer C., Olivera B.M. & Bouchet P. (2015). One, four or 100 genera? A new classification of the cone snails. Journal of Molluscan Studies. 81: 1-23
